title: National Government Services Portal
description: National Government Services Portal of India provides single window access to services offered by the various Indian Government entities. This Portal is an initiative under the India Portal Project and has been designed and developed by National Informatics Centre (NIC), Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology, Government of India.

items.title: Dr Shivaram Karanth Layout - DSKL Betterment Tax Payment, Karnataka
items.description: This dedicated portal facilitates the payment of betterment tax for properties in the Dr. Shivaram Karanth Layout developed by the Bangalore Development Authority (BDA). Property owners can log in to view tax details, generate payment challans, and complete transactions securely online. The system streamlines the process, ensuring accurate records, quick payments, and easy access to receipts, helping citizens fulfill their statutory obligations conveniently and maintain compliance with BDA regulations.

items.title: Property Tax Payment System by Bangalore Development Authority, Karnataka
items.description: This online service allows property owners under the Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) to conveniently pay their property taxes. Users can log in to access tax details, generate challans, make secure online payments, and download receipts. The platform ensures timely tax submission, reduces paperwork, and promotes transparency, making it easier for residents to manage their property tax obligations without visiting BDA offices, thereby saving time and effort for citizens in Bengaluru.

items.title: Contribute to Chief Minister's Relief Fund, Punjab
items.description: This official portal enables citizens to contribute directly to the Chief Minister's Relief Fund, Punjab. The fund supports people affected by natural disasters, medical emergencies, and other crises. Through secure online transactions, donors can extend financial aid to vulnerable individuals and communities in need. Contributions are utilized transparently for humanitarian assistance, reflecting the government’s commitment to citizen welfare. The portal encourages public participation in social...

items.title: Online Checkpost Tax Payment of Vehicles, Bihar
items.description: This online Checkpost Tax Payment service in Bihar enables vehicle owners and transporters to pay commercial vehicle entry tax and other applicable fees digitally. The portal ensures faster transactions, reduced paperwork, and transparency in tax collection at checkposts. Users can log in, calculate dues, and make secure online payments easily. By streamlining tax compliance, the system saves time for transport operators and supports hassle-free vehicle movement across state borders while strengthening...

items.title: Login for Integrated Financial Management and Information System, Telangana
items.description: Entrusted with the prudent management of Telangana's financial resources, the State Finance Department ensures meticulous maintenance of all financial transaction records. It also plays a crucial role in formulating and administering the state's fiscal policies.

items.title: Goods and Services Tax - GST Services
items.description: GST is a unified tax system that replaced multiple indirect taxes levied by both the Central and State Governments. Under GST, both the Central and State Governments share the authority to levy and collect taxes on goods and services. This has led to greater harmonization and uniformity in the tax structure across States, promoting economic integration. The GST system follows a dual structure, comprising Central GST (CGST) and State GST (SGST), levied concurrently by the Central and State governments,...

items.description: This service facilitates applications for Enrollment Certificates (EC) and Registration Certificates (RC), EC payments, updates to names, addresses, and categories, bank details updates, and exemption and cancellation requests in Gujarat.

items.title: e-Pauti Online Land Revenue Payment, Odisha
items.description: e-Pauti Online Land Revenue Payment by Revenue & Disaster Management Department. The main aim of this application is to provide individuals with a simpler method for making their land revenue payments online. Through this platform, users can conveniently settle their "Khajana" dues and retrieve their receipts online. Additionally, if users misplace their receipts or require transaction details, we also facilitate easy retrieval of transaction numbers and subsequent receipt downloads.

items.title: Holding and Property Tax Payment, Odisha
items.description: Holding and Property Tax Payment service enables citizens to conveniently pay their essential taxes to their local urban authorities. Odishaone, a unified Integrated Service Delivery portal created by Odisha Computer Application Centre (OCAC), serves as the front-end interface for all e-Governance Applications across different departments. It aims to offer simple, accessible access to government services, both informational and transactional, anytime and anywhere.

items.description: Chief Minister's relief fund provides required treatments to the distressed people affected by the major natural calamities like flood, drought, fire accident etc, and it also provides the financial assistance to the needy individuals for their treatment of major diseases like; Cancer, Cardiac surgery & Kidney transplant, Brain Tumor, Liver & Multi Organ failure etc.

items.description: The Aikyashree Scholarship, initiated by the West Bengal government, offers financial aid to economically disadvantaged minority students, facilitating their educational pursuits. items.title: Online Contributions / Donations to National Defence Fund (NDF)
items.description: The National Defence Fund (NDF) accepts voluntary donations from individuals, organizations, trusts, companies, and institutions to support the welfare of the armed forces and their families. You can conveniently contribute online through the official NDF portal. Every contribution strengthens national solidarity and supports brave soldiers and their dependents. Donations are eligible for tax exemption under Section 80G of the Income Tax Act.
